doc:
Philippe Clay https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippe_Clay 0 Philippe Clay (7 March 1927 – 13 December 2007), born Philippe Mathevet, was a French mime artist, singer and actor. He was known for his tall and slim silhouette (he was 1.90 m tall) and for his interpretations of songs by Charles Aznavour, Claude Nougaro, Jean-Roger Caussimon, Boris Vian, Serge Gainsbourg, Jean Yanne, Léo Ferré, Jacques Datin, Jean-Claude Massoulier or Bernard Dimey. He interpreted “La Complainte des Apaches” for the TV series Les Brigades du Tigre, written by Henri Djian and composed by Claude Bolling. As an actor, he appeared in many movies (Bell, Book and Candle) and television films. One of his famous roles is in the Jean Renoir film, French Cancan, where he played Casimir le Serpentin (a character inspired by Valentin le désossé). Philippe_Clay ( 7_March_1927 – 13_December_2007 ) , born Philippe_Mathevet , was a_French_mime_artist , singer_and_actor . He was_known for his_tall_and_slim_silhouette ( he was 1.90_m_tall_) and for his_interpretations of songs by Charles_Aznavour , Claude_Nougaro , Jean-Roger_Caussimon , Boris_Vian , Serge_Gainsbourg , Jean_Yanne , Léo_Ferré , Jacques_Datin , Jean-Claude_Massoulier or Bernard_Dimey . He interpreted “ La_Complainte_des_Apaches ” for the_TV_series_Les_Brigades_du_Tigre , written by Henri_Djian and composed by Claude_Bolling . As an_actor , he appeared in many_movies_(_Bell_,_Book_and_Candle_)_and_television_films . One of his_famous_roles is in the_Jean_Renoir_film , French_Cancan , where he played Casimir le_Serpentin ( a_character inspired by Valentin le_désossé_) .
